What are you looking for Advanced Search Home > All Categories > Local Businesses > United Kingdom > London > Resolved Question Joseph Member since: November 03, 2011 Total points: 91 (Level 1) Add Contact Block
Resolved Question Show me another » What is the average number of deliveries per night for a fast food restaurant in London, UK? -If demand was there and you could easily keep up, how many deliveries would be reasonable to expect? -if someone can answer this I wonder do you also have any idea what the average utility bill might be for a kebab shop? just the standard grill/rotating grill/fryer/fridge set up
thanks in advance I would be most appreciative of any help here 8 months ago Report Abuse by Ed Fox Member since: November 10, 2010 Total points: 102,280 (Level 7) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters OMG! Not another Kebab shop. London's full of them. You want a KFC or a Mickey D's but can you find one when you need one? No all you can see are f--king kebab shops. 8 months ago Report Abuse 67% 2 Votes Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 0 ) Save Add to My Yahoo! RSS
There are currently no comments for this question.

Other Answers (1)
by Xl Gondola Member since: June 29, 2011 Total points: 8,561 (Level 5) Add Contact Block You're asking for an out and out guess based on a steady demand, Unless you know how long it takes to prepare each dish, how will you know if you have the capacity to keep up with demand?
For the second part of your question, just get hold of the published company accounts for any mobile kebab or kebab booth business. 8 months ago Report Abuse 33% 1 Vote
